Title: vue-resume-component
Description: My first npm package which powered the CV of a previous version of this page.

Title: Apple MacBook Air
Description: Specs: M1 (Processor), 16 GB (Memory), 256 GB (Storage)

Title: ASUS ZenScreen MB16AC
Description: Mobile display, powered over USB-C which gives me a dual display set up almost everywhere.

Title: Elgato Ring Light
Description: Quite expansive, but the warmness (Kelvin) and brightness can be adjusted seamlessly (Mobile & Desktop).

Title: Elgato Streamdeck
Description: Programmable keyboard with displays which shows different keys depending on the context.

Title: Logitech Streamcam
Description: Supports default mounting options and produces a pretty good Full HD image.

Title: Netlify
Description: Connect Netlify to your repository to get a build when you push to main and also get previews in PRs.

Title: nuxt/content
Description: File based CMS for Nuxt, apropos this website is powered by nuxt/content.

Title: Playwright
Description: A Node.js browser automation framework I use it to automate websites which won't give me API access or to generate images.

Title: Rode NT-USB Mini
Description: Nice quality (as far as I can tell) and can be used without an arm.

Title: Vue.js
Description: My favorite JS framework, as it lets you use what the web was made with: HTML and CSS! And Single File Components are just awesome.

Title: Vercel
Description: Same as Netlify, but I prefer Vercel for projects with serverless functions.

Title: GitHub Actions
Description: As all my projects are on GitHub I'm just happy about such a simple solution for automation.

Title: google-webfonts-helper
Description: Tool to help you host Google fonts without the CDN. Why should you care? GDPR, Performance, Control.

Title: Enpass
Description: I bought this password manager before they started the subscription model. Therefore, I can use it without any monthly fees.

Title: Figma
Description: Awesome vector tool, you can work live at files and share them easily.

Title: WebStorm
Description: I like it as it just works and has all the features I need built-in.

Title: WorkFlowy
Description: My go-to knowledge app, you could also call it a note app. Basically it is an endless list.

Title: Clipy
Description: A clipboard manager for macOS. No more, no less.

Title: Bookmark Divider
Description: A tool created by myself to use it as a bookmark divider between my favicon bookmarks.

Title: VS Code
Description: As I'm not a big fan of TextEdit (macOS) I use VS Code as my primarily text editor. And nowadays also for Astro.js.

Title: Slack
Description: If there is a new side project with multiple people I tend to directly create a workspace to streamline the communication.

Title: Google Workspace
Description: In my case it is used privately, but it is also very easy to set up for small to large organizations.

Title: Rectangle
Description: Move and snap windows in macOS via mouse and shortcuts.

Title: Nuxt.js
Description: Opinionated meta framework for Vue.js.
